subject: Re: [junit] Re: NoSuchMethodError at  XMLJUnitResultFormatter.startTest
msgSnippet: Use the -verbose switch on Ant, then check the classpath used to run the target. My guess is that you have an old version of JUnit or of Ant in the classpath

Use the -verbose switch on Ant, then check the classpath used to run the ta=
rget. My guess is that you have an old version of JUnit or of Ant in the cl=
asspath somewhere.

Take care.

>So said magesh_v on 2003-06-11 -----------=
---------
>Hi,
>
>This is my junit target in build.xml
>
>  <target name=3D=
"run.junit">
>    <junit printsummary=3D"yes"
>           fork=3D"yes"
>   =
        haltonfailure=3D"true">
>      <sysproperty key=3D"test.propertiesF=
ile" value=3D"Test.properties"/>
>      <formatter type=3D"xml"/>
>      <c=
lasspath path=3D"${test.class.path}" />
>      <test name=3D"${test.name}"/=
>
>    </junit>
>    <echo message=3D"+--------------"/>
>  </target>
>
>Th=
anks
>Magesh.
